ou are on the same team, you could ask him. Possibly you could even

ut by simply looking at the code and/or the JUnit tests.

You are correct, =
but I actually meant that at runtime, my code does not know why your code t=
hrew an NPE.

>One point I find more critical is that invalid input should =
be
>fail-fast. If a method fails because you provided invalid input to a
>p=
rior method call, such problems are really hard to find. Can 
>JTest help
>=
with such issues?

Off the top of my head I doubt that Jtest can explicitly=
 help with this, but if all of your exposed APIs are "hardened" or made rob=
ust enough to satisfy Jtest, then there is a good likelihood that invalid p=
arameter data will be rejected sooner rather than later.

>Regards, Ilja
